pages.text: Bivalves are marine and freshwater molluscs with compressed bodies protected by an outer shell which consists of two hinged parts. They have gills and the majority are filter feeders. Many bivalves will bury themselves into the sediment in order to protect from predators. Bivalves became important reef builders from the Ordovician onwards.
